<@U028QE2PEPN> Did you check for special characters? There are safe characters, reserved characters and as well some that arenâ€™t allowed in URLs. Maybe you need some encode and decode logic here or extend your validation script to prevent special characters. I mean, double names have a space in between. That's already a special character.

Example:
<https://www.w3schools.com/jsref/jsref_decodeURIComponent.asp>
<@UK9BKNBD5> Thats a great observation. Did not think about it. :slightly_smiling_face: Thank you, i ll check it :slightly_smiling_face:
